item.title: Tips on K8s
item.description: Kubernetes Tips: Selfhelp page to test and learn about Kubernetes. Install kubectl that CLI to access and control cluster. On Ubuntu $ sudo snap install kubectl --classic To test kubectl try the following $ kubectl version the output would be as follows: Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11", GitVersion:"v1.11.0", GitCommit:"91e7b4fd3c980becec37ceefe", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-06-27T20:17:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} The connection to the server localhost:8080 was refused - did you specify the right host or port?
